marketNews.title: BBNI 9M25: Net Profit -7% YoY, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) recorded a net profit of 5 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-11% YoY, +7% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to reach 15.1 trillion rupiah (-7% YoY), equivalent to 73% of the consensus 2025F estimate. Although the 9M25 realization is below the historical seasonal trend (vs. 9M24: 76% of 2024 realization, 9M23: 75% of 2023 realization), the net profit in 3Q25 was burdened by management's decision to bring forward some opex and provision expenses that were due to be booked in 4Q25 to 3Q25. Therefore, we assess the 9M25 net profit realization as performance that is still in line with expectations. Non-Interest Income was the highlight in 3Q25 with a growth of +12% YoY and +23% QoQ, driven by gains from government bonds and solid transaction banking activities in general.

marketNews.title: Maintaining Credit Growth and CoC Guidance, Revising Down 2025 NIM Guidance
marketNews.content: Despite receiving liquidity injection from the government, BBNI management stated in the 3Q25 earnings call that they are still maintaining the 2025 credit growth guidance in the range of +8-10% YoY, with realization as of September 2025 standing at +10% YoY (vs. June 2025: +7% YoY). BBNI has disbursed approximately 50% of the government's liquidity injection funds as of September 2025, as we previously summarized. Segmentally, BBNI revealed that credit demand from the corporate segment remains high, while no strengthening in consumer segment demand has been observed. Regarding the 2026 guidance, BBNI management is still in discussions but estimates that credit growth potential will be slightly higher than in 2025. From the margin aspect, management foresees that loan yield may tend to decline starting in 4Q25 and into 2026F along with the trend of declining interest rates and looser liquidity. The guidance for 2025 Net Interest Margin (NIM) was revised down from ≥3.8% to ~3.7%, indicating that loan yield pressure potentially outweighs the impact of the decline in Cost of Fund (CoF). In September 2025, MTD CoF decreased to 2.8% from 3.1% in August 2025, driven by increased liquidity which started to reduce the special rate. Asset quality relatively improved, with Special Mention Loans (SML) and Loan-at-Risk (LAR) declining quarter-on-quarter, while Non-Performing Loans (NPL) were relatively stable quarter-on-quarter in 3Q25.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: As we previously wrote in the Stockbit Commentary, we see BBNI's performance potentially starting to accelerate in 4Q25, which we also see reflected in the management's view. BBNI itself has strengthened +14% since we released the 'Tactical Rotation' Commentary and is currently trading at a valuation of 0.92x 1-Year Forward P/BV, about 0.5 standard deviations below the historical 5-year average. With attractive valuation and dividends, as well as prospects for future performance improvement, we maintain a positive view on the banking sector, including BBNI.

marketNews.title: Not Economy Driving the Market, But This Factor
marketNews.content: "Boom and crash are not about news, but about how fast money flows." - ariroycehidayat

tickerNews.title: TPIA Will Acquire Esso Gas Station Network from ExxonMobil in Singapore
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific announced that it has signed an agreement to acquire the Esso-branded retail fuel station network belonging to ExxonMobil in Singapore. The transaction value was not disclosed, but Reuters reported that the transaction is expected to be completed by the end of 2025. This strategic acquisition is in line with the company's long-term growth strategy focused on developing integrated energy infrastructure for the energy and mobility solutions market in Singapore and Southeast Asia. TPIA will continue to use the Esso brand, continue fuel procurement under the ExxonMobil brand, and retain all existing customer loyalty points and cards.

tickerNews.title: GIAA COO States Rights Issue to Follow Private Placement to Boost Public Shareholding
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Danantara COO, Dony Oskaria, told Bloomberg Technoz that the company will hold a rights issue for Garuda Indonesia after the company completes its private placement. This plan is aimed at increasing the public shareholding portion diluted after the private placement. Dony also stated that the private placement support will enable GIAA to book a profit next year, although he did not elaborate further. Previously, Danantara planned to inject capital of up to approximately US$1.85 billion into GIAA via private placement, which would cause the public ownership portion to dilute from 27.46% to ~5.03%, while Danantara's portion would increase from 64.54% to ~93.5%.

tickerNews.title: BBTN 9M25 Net Profit +11% YoY, Supported by PPOP Growth, Provisions Hike to Boost Coverage Ratio
tickerNews.content: $BBTN: Bank Tabungan Negara recorded a net profit of 596 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+3% YoY, -26% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 2.3 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 69% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 69% annual realization). The 9M25 net profit performance was supported by an increase in PPOP (+84% YoY), following the adjustment in the effective interest income calculation for the non-subsidized mortgage segment. Provision expenses increased by +230% YoY as an effort to raise the NPL Coverage Ratio to the range of 115-120% (vs. 9M25: 110.5%). Although the 2025 credit growth target remains unchanged in the range of +7-9% YoY, BBTN management provided a conservative indication of potentially higher credit growth in 2026 to the range of +10-11% YoY. Meanwhile, CoC in 2026 is also expected to drop to the range of 1-1.1%, while increasing the NPL Coverage Ratio to the range of 120-130%, indicating potential asset quality improvement.

tickerNews.title: HMSP Cigarette Sales Volume Drops -2% YoY in 9M25, Market Share Above 30%
tickerNews.content: $HMSP: Philip Morris International recorded that Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna's cigarette sales volume dropped -3% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: -4% YoY, 1Q25: +1% YoY), resulting in a 9M25 sales volume decline of -2% YoY (vs. 1H25: -2% YoY, 9M24: -5% YoY%). On the other hand, the industry's sales volume experienced a deeper decline (-4% YoY, vs. 9M24: +1% YoY). This result kept HMSP's market share above the 30% level in 3Q25 (30.7%) and throughout 9M25 (30.9%) (vs. 1H25: 31%, 9M24: 30.3%), after having dipped below 30% in the 4Q24-1Q25 period. Based on segmentation, cigarette sales fell -2% YoY, while IQOS sales rose +26% YoY during 9M25.

tickerNews.title: DMAS 9M25 Marketing Sales at 35% of Target Amidst Economic Uncertainty
tickerNews.content: $DMAS: Puradelta Lestari recorded marketing sales of 46 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-87% YoY, -59% QoQ). This result brought 9M25 marketing sales to 626 billion rupiah (-57% YoY), equivalent to ~35% of the 2025 target of 1.81 trillion rupiah. DMAS Director & Corporate Secretary, Tondy Suwanto, stated that the company recorded industrial land sales of 18 hectares during 9M25 (vs. 1H25: 18 hectares). Tondy said that economic uncertainty, geopolitics, and national politics are causing investors to adopt a wait-and-see attitude. However, the company continues to strive to achieve the 2025 target, in connection with a pipeline of about 75 hectares.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Partial Funding for Pipe-Laying Vessel Purchase via Promissory Notes, Including SKRN
tickerNews.content: $CBRE: Cakra Buana Resources Energi announced that the purchase of 1 pipe-laying and lifting vessel unit valued at 100 million US dollars from Hilong Shipping Holding Limited will be partially funded by a promissory note mechanism totaling 55 million US dollars. The promissory note has a tenor of 60 months with an interest rate of 3% per year. CBRE will issue a promissory note worth 25 million US dollars to Hilong Shipping Holding Limited, while the remainder will be issued to third parties consisting of Yafin Tandiono Tan for 11 million US dollars, Superkrane Mitra Utama ($SKRN) for 6.5 million US dollars, and PT Saga Investama Sedaya for 12.5 million US dollars. The remaining payment for the vessel purchase transaction, amounting to 45 million US dollars, must be settled no later than December 31, 2025. The plan for the vessel purchase and the issuance of the promissory note will be carried out after obtaining shareholder approval in the Extraordinary General Meeting (RUPSLB) on October 27, 2025.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Controller Sells Shares to Realize Investment and Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: $IMPC: Impack Pratama Industri's controller, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, sold approximately 1.15 billion IMPC shares at an average price of 736 rupiah per share on October 23, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 850 billion rupiah and was intended for investment realization and increasing the free float. After this transaction, the direct ownership of PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa in IMPC decreased from 44.24% to 42.14%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Director Yulisar Khiat Sells Shares, Reducing Stake to 7.09%
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina Director, Yulisar Khiat, was recorded selling approximately 182 million (1.19%) HEAL shares, based on KSEI data as of October 22, 2025. The total transaction value is unknown. After this transaction, Yulisar Khiat's ownership in HEAL decreased from 8.28% to 7.09%. Yulisar previously served as the company's finance director before being officially appointed as president director on Thursday (23/10).

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia to Provide Macroprudential Liquidity Incentives to Banks Based on Credit Interest Rate Elasticity
tickerNews.content: Based on the earnings call presentation of Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN), Bank Indonesia will provide macroprudential liquidity incentives to banks amounting to: 1) 0.4% of DPK if the elasticity of the bank's related credit interest rate reduction relative to the BI Rate reduction is ≥0.3-<0.6%; or 2) 0.5% of DPK if the elasticity of the bank's related credit interest rate reduction relative to the BI Rate reduction is ≥0.6%. Previously, Bank Indonesia announced it would expand the macroprudential liquidity incentive provisions starting December 1, 2025, by providing incentives for banks that reduce their credit interest rates. This incentive aims to accelerate the transmission of monetary policy.

tickerNews.title: Minister of ESDM Indicates Potential 6-Month Copper Concentrate Export Permit for AMMN
tickerNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Friday (24/10) that the government is likely to grant a six-month copper concentrate export permit to Amman Mineral Internasional ($AMMN). However, Bahlil did not specify when the export permit would be issued. Previously, AMMN reportedly applied to the government for an extension of its copper concentrate and cathode export permit because the commissioning process for its smelter facility had not yet reached full operation. Previously, AMMN reportedly applied to the government to extend its copper concentrate and cathode export permit because the commissioning process for its smelter facility had not yet reached full operation.

tickerNews.title: Ministry of Communication and Digital Considers Regulation for Direct Satellite Mobile Service Access
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Communication and Digital is considering releasing regulations that allow the public to access cellular services directly from telecommunication satellites without going through base transceiver stations (BTS). This plan is intended to expand communication service coverage to remote areas, border areas, waters, and air routes. Responding to this issue, the Executive Director of the Association of Indonesian Telecommunication Providers (ATSI), Marwan O Baasir, told Kompas that the association is still discussing the discourse and is still evaluating the existing study documents.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Shareholder Sells 954.8 Million Shares, Reducing Direct Ownership
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa ($DEWA) shareholder, PT Antareja Mahada Makmur, sold approximately 954.8 million DEWA shares on October 20, 2025, at an average price of 75 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 71.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership of PT Antareja Mahada Makmur in DEWA decreased from 9.72% to 7.37%.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Signs Multi-Year Agreement with Qualcomm for Fixed Wireless Access Platform Solution
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI) signed a multi-year cooperation agreement with Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. for the provision of the Qualcomm Dragonwing platform solution on its fixed wireless access network in the 1.4 GHz spectrum. This collaboration is expected to help expand broadband access and connectivity, and support the company's affordable broadband project targeting a potential market of up to 25 million households in the next 5 years.

tickerNews.title: GPSO New Controller Plans Mandatory Tender Offer for 54.55% Shares at 436 Rupiah/Share
tickerNews.content: Geoprima Solusi's ($GPSO) new controller, PT PIMSF Pulogadung, plans to carry out a mandatory tender offer for 54.55% of GPSO shares at an offer price of 436 rupiah per share, totaling approximately 158.6 billion rupiah. This mandatory tender offer will take place from October 22 to November 21, 2025, with payment on November 25, 2025. This corporate action follows the completion of the acquisition of 45.45% of GPSO shares by PT PIMSF Pulogadung at an average price of 66 rupiah per share, totaling approximately 20 billion rupiah, on October 16, 2025.

tickerNews.title: GPRA Controller Sells ~483 Million Shares, Stake Drops to 43.29%
tickerNews.content: Perdana Gapura Prima's ($GPRA) controller, PT Abadimukti Gunalestari, sold approximately 483 million GPRA shares between October 15-21, 2025, at an average price of approximately 125 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 60.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership of PT Abadimukti Gunalestari in GPRA decreased from 54.59% to 43.29%.
